text: The executive power of the government of Norway is headed by Jonas Gahr Støre. Støre's time in power started in 2021. On October 14, the cabinet was formed by politicians from two political parties: the Labour party and the Centre Party. The cabinet has (as of 2024) 20 ministers, 56 state secretaries and 21 advisors.https://www.nrk.no/vestland/regjeringsapparatet-veks_-store- regjeringa-har-97-tilsette-1.16687143. Retrieved 2024-01-03 The foreign relations have resulted in a meeting between *Russia's foreign minister and prime minister Støre, in Norway in October 2021.https://www.vg.no/nyheter/innenriks/i/mrz1J0/stoere-etter-lavrov-moete- oensker-aa-ha-et-greit-og-politisk-samarbeid-med-vaar-nabo. Retrieved 26 October 2021 ==Ministers (or members of the Cabinet)== Position Name Prime minister Jonas Gahr Støre His time in power started on October 14, 2021.https://www.vg.no/spesial/2021/regjeringen/?utm_source=vgfront&utm;_content=hovedlopet_row13_pos2. Retrieved 14 October 2021 Finance minister Jens Stoltenberg Since February 2025 Foreign minister Espen Barth Eide Since 2023 Justice and public security minister Astri Aas-Hansen Since February 2025 Trade and industry minister Cecilie Myrseth Since 2024 Transport and communications minister Jon-Ivar Nygård Since 2021 Labour, social affairs, and integration Tonje Brenna Since 2023 Energy minister ("Oil and energy minister" was the name until 2024) Terje Aasland The office is held by Labour Party politicians (while the Støre Cabinet is in power). Health and care services minister Jan Christian Vestre Since 2024https://www.vg.no/nyheter/innenriks/i/1MPzvB/her-er-stoeres-nye- statsraader-jan-christian-vestre-marianne-sivertsen-naess-og-cecilie-myrseth. Retrieved 2024-04-19 Culture and equality minister, sometimes called "Culture minister" Lubna Jaffery Since 2023 Climate and the Environment minister Andreas Bjelland Eriksen The man that [acted] as minister (Octoberhttps://www.sagat.no/nyheter/minister-til-nesten-tomt- sameting/19.47003. Retrieved 2024-10-24 [thru December] 2024) is Tore O. Sandvik. The office is held by Labour Party politicians. Defense minister Tore O. Sandvik Since February 2025 Local government and modernisation minister Kjersti Stenseng Since February 2025 Higher education and research minister Sigrun Aasland Since February 2025.https://www.vg.no/nyheter/i/l3GbrG/statsministeren-varsler-endringer-i- regjeringen Education minister Kari Nessa Nordtun Since 2023 Agriculture and food minister Nils Kristen Sandtrøen "Family minister",https://www.dagbladet.no/nyheter/hun-blir-ny- familieminister/74391440. Retrieved 16 October 2021 or Children and families minister Lene Vågslid Since February 2025 International development minister Anne Beathe Tvinnereim Since 2021 Fisheries minister Marianne Sivertsen Næss Since 2024 Digitalisation and Public governance minister Karianne Tung Since 2023 ===Old information=== Position Name Finance minister Trygve Slagsvold Vedum 2021 until February 2025 Justice minister Emilie Enger Mehl 2021 until February 2025. She was chosen from one of the districts of Innlandet county, to become a member of parliament.https://www.vg.no/nyheter/innenriks/i/bGq7xA/mehl-28-blir-tidenes- yngste-justisminister-hylles-av-politiske-motstandere. Retrieved 14 October 2021 Defense minister Bjørn Arild Gram Until February 2025 "Family minister",https://www.dagbladet.no/nyheter/hun-blir-ny- familieminister/74391440. Retrieved 16 October 2021 or Children and families minister Kjersti Toppe 2021 until February 2025 Agriculture and food minister Geir Pollestad Until February 2025 Trade and industry minister Jan Christian Vestre Since 2021https://direkte.dn.no/nyhetsstudio/#95701. Retrieved 15 October 2021 Fisheries minister Cecilie Myrseth Higher education and research minister Oddmund Løkensgard Hoel From 2024 [to February 2025].https://www.vg.no/nyheter/i/l3GbrG/statsministeren-varsler-endringer-i- regjeringen Health and care services minister Ingvild Kjerkol Resigned in April 2024.https://www.nettavisen.no/nyheter/sterke-reaksjoner-pa-kjerkols- oppforsel-toppen-av-frekkhet/s/5-95-1757528. Retrieved 2024-04-13 Earlier that month her master's thesis (became no longer approved, or) was annulled; The reason for that was plagiarism.https://www.nrk.no/norge/kilder-til-nrk_- kjerkols-oppgave-underkjennes-1.16839940. Retrieved 2024-04-11https://www.vg.no/nyheter/innenriks/i/GMk6Pq/kjerkol-om- masteroppgaven-det-burde-ikke-skjedd. Retrieved 2024-01-22 She came into office in 2021.https://www.nrk.no/norge/regjeringen-utreder-ikke-reglene-for- tvillingabort-1.15695264. Retrieved 19 October 2021 Higher education and research minister Sandra Borch She left office in January 2024.https://www.nrk.no/tromsogfinnmark/deler-av-borchs-masteroppgave- identisk-med-tidligere-studenters-tekster-1.16724668 Education minister Tonje Brenna Since 2021 Climate and the Environment minister Espen Barth Eide In office, from 2021 to 2023 Agriculture and food minister Sandra Borch Since 2021 https://www.vg.no/nyheter/innenriks/i/jamKn9/handikapforbundet-sandra-er- en-rollemodell. Retrieved 14 October 2021 Foreign minister Anniken Huitfeldt In office, from 2021 to 2023;https://direkte.vg.no/nyhetsdognet/news/russlands-utenriksminister- kommer-til- tromsoe.s3Q09Ds56?utm_source=vgfront&utm;_content=hovedlopet_row41_pos1. Retrieved 14 October 2021 In October 2021, Russia's foreign minister and Huitfeldt placed flowers near the grave of Soviet soldiers, in Tromsø; Afterwards foreign minister Lavrov and Huitfeldt had bilateral talks. Labour, social affairs, and integration Hadia Tajik Was in office from 2021 Culture and equality minister, sometimes called "Culture minister" Anette Trettebergstuen In office, from 2021 to 2023 Defense minister Odd Roger Enoksen Was in office from 2021; He comes from Nordland county.https://direkte.vg.no/nyhetsdognet/news/ny-forsvarsminister- skuffet.CG0vu2q3U?utm_source=vgfront&utm;_content=direktewidget&utm;_medium=direktewidget_nyhetsdognet. Retrieved 14 October 2021 Local government and modernisation minister Bjørn Arild Gram Was in office from 2021 Energy minister ("Oil and energy minister" was the name until 2024) Marte Mjøs Persen Was in office since 2021 Higher education and research minister Ola Borten Moe Was in office from 2021;https://www.dagsavisen.no/nyheter/politikk/2021/10/14/studentenes-krav- til-ola-borten-moe-forventer-at-han-oker-studiestotten/. Retrieved 14 October 2021 He resigned. Fisheries minister Bjørnar Skjæran Was in office from 2021 Sigbjørn Gjelsvik Was in office from 2021 ==Related pages== *Cabinet ==References== Category:Politics of Norway
